alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Emmet; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Gusty South Winds Increasing to West Southwest Between 630 PM and 730 PM this Evening... Strong low pressure over Central Nebraska is enhancing south wind gusts to near 40 to 45 mph at times this evening. An area of thunderstorms is entering northwest Iowa with a rather strong gust front, accompanied by a wall of dust. This is moving east northeast and may enter the Pocahontas and Emmet County areas between 630 and 730 pm this evening. Wind speeds may continue over 50 mph with the gust front and visibility may lower to under a mile at times. Persons should be aware of the potential for adverse travel conditions this evening in this area and be prepared for a period of strong winds. The gust front should weaken somewhat as it moves east, but some areas of blowing dust may still occur farther east this evening. Persons traveling over the region should be ready for cross winds this evening; particularly if driving a high profile vehicles as well as potentially low visibility. Please drive carefully.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Emmet; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Webster
